message.content: We use the formula for penetrance: (number of individuals with disease phenotype/number of individuals with disease-producing genotype) x 100. In this case, the penetrance is (10/40) x 100 = 25%. Therefore, the answer is (B).

We use the formula for penetrance, which is the proportion of individuals with a disease-associated genotype who express the disease phenotype. Penetrance = (number of individuals expressing the disease phenotype / total number of individuals with disease-associated genotype) x 100%. Applying this formula to the given data: Penetrance = (10/40) x 100% = 25%. Therefore, the answer is (B).

We use the formula for penetrance, which is the proportion of individuals with a disease-causing genotype who actually exhibit the disease phenotype. Penetrance = (number of individuals with disease-causing genotype and disease phenotype / total number of individuals with disease-causing genotype) x 100%. Plugging in the numbers, we get (10/40) x 100% = 25%. Therefore, the chance of developing the disease phenotype with the disease-causing genotype is 25%. The answer is (B).

The chance of developing the disease phenotype with the disease-producing genotype can be calculated as (number of patients with disease phenotype / number of patients with disease-producing genotype) x 100. Using the information provided in the question, the calculation will be (10/40) x 100 = 25%. Therefore, the correct answer is (B).

We use the given information to calculate the penetrance of the disease. Out of the 40 with the disease-producing genotype, only 10 presented with symptoms. This means the penetrance is 10/40 or 25%. Therefore, the chances of the screened patients with said genotype developing the disease phenotype is 25%, which corresponds to option (B).

We can use the information given to calculate the penetrance of the disease. Penetrance is the percentage of individuals with a specific genotype who exhibit the associated phenotype. In this case, 40 out of 120 patients have the disease-producing genotype, but only 10 present with symptoms. This means that the penetrance of the disease is (10/40) x 100 = 25%. Therefore, the answer is (B).

We can calculate the penetrance of the disease by dividing the number of individuals with the disease phenotype by the number of individuals with the disease genotype. In this case, the penetrance would be 10/40 or 0.25, which is equivalent to 25%. Therefore, the correct answer is (B).

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Penetrance refers to the proportion of individuals with a disease-causing genotype who also display the disease phenotype. In this case, 40 individuals have the disease-producing genotype, but only 10 have the disease phenotype, so the penetrance is 25%. This means that of the individuals with the genotype, 25% will develop the disease phenotype. Therefore, the answer is option (B), 25%.

We use the given information to calculate the penetrance of the disease. The total number of screened patients with family history and disease-producing genotype is 40. Out of these, only 10 presented with symptoms, which means 30 did not present with symptoms. Therefore, the penetrance of the disease is 10/40 = 0.25 or 25%. Therefore, the answer is (B).

We use the formula: (number of individuals with disease-producing genotype and disease phenotype/total number of individuals with disease-producing genotype) x 100%. Plugging in the values given in the question, we get (10/40) x 100% = 25%. Therefore, the chances of the screened patients with said genotype developing the disease phenotype is 25%. The correct answer is (B).
